author: Indianapolis Star, Christine Fernando, Special to IndyStar
title: Stunned by coronavirus, a college town slowly awakens to a surreal new normal
description: The coronavirus epidemic has emptied college towns such as Bloomington, home to Indiana University. The semester was cut short, and the fall semester is in jeopardy.
content:
BLOOMINGTON, Ind.  Spring break beckoned, flights were booked. But with one official email after another, it all began to crumble.
At Indiana Universitys flagship campus, with more than 30,000 undergraduate students, classes moved online. Students hastily pa… [+20407 chars]
